channel.description: Recent content in Papers on Andrea Piano Mortari

item.title: The interplay between excess weight and hyper-glycemia on NCDs in Italy: results from a cross-sectional study
item.description: We evaluate the prevalence of chronic comorbidities according to BMI classes and assess the interplay between excess body weight and blood glucose abnormalities in increasing the risk of major chronic diseases.

item.title: Lifetime costs of overweight and obesity in Italy
item.description: We simulate BMI lifetime profile costs based on longitudinal electronic clinical data on a large representative sample of the Italian population

item.title: Outpatient healthcare costs associated with overweight and obesity in Italy
item.description: Data relative to 991,917 adults were analyzed. Annual per capita expenditure rose from 252.2 Euro among individuals with normal weight to 752.9 Euro among those with class 3 obesity

item.title: Psychotropic drug purchases during the COVID-19 pandemic in Italy and their relationship with mobility restrictions
item.description: We investigate the substantial increase in self-reported sleep disorders, anxiety and depressive symptoms during lockdown periods

item.title: Health status and the Great Recession. Evidence from electronic health records
item.description: We investigate the impact of the Great Recession in Italy on the incidence of chronic diseases using new individual longitudinal data from Electronic Health Records

item.title: The Returns to Preventing Chronic Disease in Europe and the United States
item.description: Using the Future Elderly Model, we simulate longevity and disability over the remaining lifetime for cohorts of older Europeans and Americans

item.title: LongITools: Dynamic longitudinal exposome trajectories in cardiovascular and metabolic noncommunicable diseases
item.description: We study the complex environmental contributors to the surge in cardiovascular and metabolic noncommunicable diseases

item.title: The future of the elderly population health status: Filling a knowledge gap
item.description: We present the results obtained from several dynamic microsimulation models of the Future Elderly Model family for 12 OECD countries

item.title: How health policy shapes healthcare sector productivity? Evidence from Italy and UK
item.description: We compare trends in productivity growth of the English and the Italian healthcare systems using microdata.

item.title: Trends in age‚Äêrelated disease burden and healthcare utilization
item.description: We document rising trends in the prevalence of chronic disease and associated healthcare costs in Italy

item.title: Spatial panel-data models using Stata
item.description: xsmle is a user-written command for spatial panel analysis.

item.title: Excess body weight increases the burden of age-associated chronic diseases and their associated health care expenditures
item.description: We study how aging and excessive adiposity drive increasing health costs.

item.title: Measuring spatial effects in the presence of institutional constraints: The case of Italian Local Health Authority expenditure
item.description: We investigate the issue of measuring spatial spillovers in the presence of institutional constraints that can be geographically defined
